meanings.definition: A condition in which the bone marrow produces an excessive number of immature red blood cells.
meanings.sent1: Erythroblastosis can cause a high amount of young red blood cells to be made in the bone marrow.
meanings.sent2: Doctors diagnosed the patient with erythroblastosis after finding too many immature red blood cells.
meanings.sent3: The classroom was like a bone marrow factory in erythroblastosis, churning out lots of young red blood cells.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for painting was like erythroblastosis, creating an overflow of vibrant red hues.
meanings.sent5: In the garden of the body, erythroblastosis bloomed with an abundance of young red blood cells.

meanings.definition: A disease in which the mother's antibodies attack the red blood cells of the fetus, leading to anemia.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that erythroblastosis occurs when the mother's antibodies harm the baby's red blood cells.
meanings.sent2: Erythroblastosis can be dangerous for the baby as it causes anemia due to the mother's antibodies attacking the red blood cells.
meanings.sent3: The rivalry between the mother's antibodies and the baby's red blood cells in erythroblastosis was like a tiny battle inside the womb.
meanings.sent4: The impact of her words on him was like erythroblastosis, slowly draining the life out of their relationship.
meanings.sent5: In the story of pregnancy, erythroblastosis played the villain, attacking the innocent red blood cells of the fetus.
